summary: The Department of Defense has a program to oversee U.S. military sales to foreign governments. DOD charges foreign government purchasers fees to help cover the cost of its military sales program. We looked at DOD’s financial oversight of these fees. We found that DOD lacks reliable data on how it uses the fees to cover the program's operating expenses, including costs for paying program staff...
title: Foreign Military Sales: Financial Oversight of the Use of Overhead Funds Needs Strengthening
